args:
Aldred mistook the prince and his friends for
members of a criminal organization called the
Syndicate. After clearing that up, a top member
of the Syndicate known as the Doctor appears
and hints at a wicked plan. Hoping to stop his
ambitions, the prince and friends give chase.
Unnngh... Wh-where...am I...?\nAnd why won't my body...move?
Heh... Looks like the dragon's\npower swallowed me whole.
Guys, look! It's Mr. Dragon Guy,\nand he's back in human form!
Ah, Andromeda. I see you...\nbrought our new friends...
Very good... Now come at me...\nLet me...kill you for real...!
I don't think you're in the shape to kill\nmuch of anything, much less a large\nparty of armed fighters like us.
Shut up! So long as I can move a single\nfinger, I WILL have my revenge!
Aldred, stop it! These people\naren't with the Syndicate!
But this guy can shapeshift! You saw it!
If you'll just calm down and give me\na second, I can explain...
...So you can shapeshift because you're\npart of the Alberian royal family?!
Bingo. Now it's yer turn to make with the\nconfession, rage boy. What's the deal?
Please forgive us if you can; the blame\nfor all of this begins with the Syndicate.

A shadowy organization that operates
behind the scenes. They attack towns,
kidnap the residents, and use them to
perform terrible human experiments.
They also conduct research into magic\nso deadly it has the potential to wipe\nentire cities off the map.
How have I never heard of such\na frightful organization?!
'Cause they're clever. Decent-society\ntypes like you wouldn't have a clue\nthat the Syndicate even exists.
Then how do the two of you\nknow so much?
They made me—or my\ncurrent body, at least.
I'm part of a Syndicate experiment called\nthe Synthetic Shapeshifting Project.
They wanted to find a way for ordinary\nfolk to gain the power of shapeshifting—\nnot just Alberian royalty.
And I was one of the guinea pigs in their\nlittle experiment.
They fused my body with a dragon's,\nand the result is the warped nightmare\nthat stands before you now.

But shapeshifting is about making a pact
with a dragon—it requires a solemn bond!
The very idea of bypassing that goes
against everything in nature!

You and the Syndicate disagree there.
Anyway, they eventually decided that
I was a failure of an experiment, so I
took the chance to make my escape.
He saved me from them as well.
So when I shapeshifted, you assumed I\nwas associated with the Syndicate.
Guess you weren't expecting to find an\nAlberian prince wandering around the\nwilderness like this, huh?
Be that as it may, your actions caused\nharm, and we are owed recompense.
Aldred! Don't be a jerk about this!\n...Look, I'm sorry. WE'RE sorry.\nWe made a terrible mistake.
Yeah, well, I s'pose we can let it slide.\nAin't exactly the first time some crazy\ncat attacked us outta nowhere.
I am glad we have one mystery solved,\nbut we still are no closer to understanding\nwhy myriad fiends attacked the village.
Ah. That would be my doing.
A pleasure to meet you, my friends.\nYou may call me the Doctor.
He's a leader of the Syndicate—AND the\nman who gave me this twisted body!
Greetings, seventh scion. I am honored\nthat you accepted my invitation.
I speak of those fiends I manipulated.\nI knew you would come if I but had them\ngather in sufficient numbers.
If this egghead don't start makin' sense\nsoon, I'm gonna start breakin' stuff!
Allow me to explain, my troglodyte friend!\nI seek nothing less than the creation of\nan Aeonian Record.
A person's death is akin to the burning of\na book. When they pass from this world,\ntheir accumulated knowledge passes also.

Would it not be wonderful to have a body
of such knowledge from which humanity
could glean new things? A body that did
not rot; that refused to decay and die?
I can see the possibilities, but have my\ndoubts as to the practicality of the plan.

Ah, then let me enlighten you as to the
existence of a certain fiend—a titan
that travels about swallowing up
all life in its path.

You may be asking, what good is life if it
has been consumed? Ah, but this fiend
is special, for those it consumes live on
inside it. Ageless. Undecaying. Immortal.
Thus, this great fiend is filled with\nthe knowledge of all life.
If such a creature actually existed,\nwe surely would know of it.
Ah, but not if it exists in the\nspace between worlds.
That foul place of black mana\nand hideous fiends?!

The very same! Although while most fiends
find their movements somewhat limited
there, this grand titan is able to travel
about at will.
This fiend is called Aspidochelone, and it\nis my design to summon it into our world!
WOW. That sounds like a GREAT plan.\n...If you can't tell, I'm being sarcastic!
There would be sacrifice, of course.\nVillages, towns, and perhaps even entire\nkingdoms would be laid to waste.
But I believe that Aspidochelone can\nserve as an Aeonian Record, which\nbalances the scales of such sacrifice.

Only a monster would be willing to
lay low so many in service to their
own selfish theories. You do not
even know if this plan will work!
Such thoughts do not concern me.\nIf my actions prove to be unjust,\nlet history judge me as it sees fit.

Well? What say you, dear Prince?
Will you assist with my experiment?
Will you take this chance to change
the course of history for the better?
I will not. Even if this theory of yours\nmight be correct, the cost of putting it\ninto action is far too great.
Aldred said you Syndicate types were evil,\nbut I think he undersold it.
Evil is a moniker I wear proudly,\nmy tympanic friend!
Ah, but what IS evil? Or what is good?\nWho among us even has the authority\nto attempt such definitions?

The mere act of living forces humans to
rob others of their lives; it forces them
to impel sacrifice upon all things that
happen across their path!

To be human is to sin. And yet, we hold
up those who fear that sin—or those who
hold themselves in purposeful ignorance
of it—as ＂virtuous.＂

The Syndicate is different. We know there
can be no life without sin, and we are the
only ones with the resolve to make the
necessary sacrifices for progress!
THAT is why I say we are evil!
You gave me this arm! This body!\nAnd I won't let you forget it!
Ah, the failed experiment. I thought I\ndisposed of you, yet here you are, back\nfrom the rubbish. Do you need something?
I want to give you a taste of the power\nyou people cursed me with!
I've no interest in you—I long since\nfinished assessing your abilities.
*sigh* So much for civil discourse.\nAh, well. We will meet again, Prince.
C'mon, boss! Let's get that creep!
That man seeks to bring calamity to the\nworld—it matters not who stops him!
I don't care about the world.
How can you say such a thing?!
Our goals are the same, Aldred. \nWe should work together.
He's got a point there. Plus, your body\nis still something of a mess, so you\nmight end up needing the help.
Fine. If you think you can handle this arm\nof mine, you're welcome to tag along.
You will be a welcome ally—\nyou AND your arm.
Tch! What a sweet-talker you are.\nJust stay outta my way, all right?!
